*   LEED Pre-Certification for ‘Platinum’ rating (Core and Shell Development) from USGBC.

*   Sword of Honour from the British Safety Council-five-star safety rating system, awarded to DLF’s commercial, retail and hospitality properties.

DLF's Corporate Social Responsibility:
*   DLF’s Corporate Social Responsibility Policy is in accordance with the provisions of Section 135 of the Companies Act, 2013 and the Rules made thereunder.

Customer Complaint Management:
*   Customer questions and complaints are handled in a transparent and timely manner.
*   A dedicated team of qualified Customer Relationship Management (CRM) personnel have been appointed to address each complaint.
*   This mechanism is communicated via the contact no./ e-mail through the very first letter of correspondence with a newly on-boarded customer.
*   The Company has implemented a robust complaint management system, implemented through a digital application. Every customer issue is recorded in the app for tracking and resolving within a defined resolution timeframe.
*   Customers can also register a complaint through the app and monitor the status of complaint resolution.
*   Customers can also write to the Company through its Customer Support Portal on DLF website: https://www.dlf.in/customer-Support, wherein each query or complaint is addressed by the CRM team.

Turnover Information:
*   Turnover of products and/ services as a percentage of turnover from all products/ service that carry information about environmental and social parameters relevant to the product: 100%
*   Turnover of products and/ services as a percentage of turnover from all products/ service that carry information about safe and responsible usage: 100%
*   Turnover of products and/ services as a percentage of turnover from all products/ service that carry information about recycling and/ or safe disposal: 100%

Consumer Complaint Data:

| Category                    | FY 2022-23 | Remarks                                                                                                                                                              | FY 2021-22 | Remarks                                                                                                                                                              |
|-----------------------------|------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Data privacy                | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     |

| Restrictive Trade Practices| 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Unfair Trade Practices      | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Other                       | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     | 0          | -                                                                                                                                                                     |

Product Recalls:
*   Due to nature of business of DLF, product recalls on account of safety issues is not applicable.

Cyber Security and Data Privacy:
*   DLF has an Information Security Policy supported by management procedures that are aimed at achieving and sustaining enterprise-level information security objectives.
*   The IT Security Policy is available on the Company’s intranet and circulated to all employees.
*   Ensuring security of information, like any other business asset, is one of the key priorities in the business processes, to prevent any theft, tampering, misuse and unauthorized access.
*   DLF constantly deploys appropriate technology, processes, resources and infrastructure for timely implementation of security controls that comply with applicable laws and incorporate leading industry practices.
*   The Company has established procedures to ensure data privacy of its customers, employees and other stakeholders.
*   It only collects customer information which is essential for the purpose of providing the product or service.
*   The collected data is protected through regular security upgrades and adequate employee training is provided to ensure safeguarding of sensitive information.
*   Additionally, DLF seeks customer’s consent before using data.

Public Policy Advocacy:
*   Circular from Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on revision of outward remittance limit from USD 1 million to USD 10 million per project towards consultancy for the projects covered under Commercial Real Estate Exposure (CRE). (Through trade chambers)
*   Applicability of Green Building Incentives or Green Blue Factor as per the Green Ratings for Integrated Habitat Assessment (GRIHA) in the Master Plan of Delhi 2041. (Through trade chambers)
*   Fast Track Clearance of the appeal cases filed with the Appellate Committee for grant of height permission of High-rise building projects from Airport Authority of India. (Through trade chambers)
*   Clarification regarding OC & CC Act (Obtaining Occupancy Certificate and Certificate for Completion) as per RERA Act (In reference to the Hon’ble Supreme Court Writ Petition Civil No. 1216/ 2020; Interim Order dated 9 January 2023) (Through trade chambers)

Social Impact Assessments (SIA):
*   Not Applicable

Rehabilitation and Resettlement (R&R):
*   Not Applicable

Community Grievance Redressal:
*   DLF engages with community members through its social arm - DLF Foundation.
*   Community stakeholders can report their concerns and grievances to DLF through dedicated channels listed on the website on DLF Foundation (https://www.dlffoundation.in/contact.php) including contact no., e-mail and office address.
*   Community members can also send any concerns or grievances by writing to the official e-mail id of DLF Foundation (dlf-foundation@dlf.in).
*   DLF is closely connected with community members through its CSR programmes. The respective programme team engages with the community stakeholders through community meetings and feedback sessions to receive and redress concerns of the communities.

Sourcing:

| Category                                                         | FY 2022-23 | FY 2021-22 |
|------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|------------|
| Directly sourced from MSMEs/ small producers                    | 37%        | 27%        |
| Sourced directly from within the district and neighbouring districts | 45%        | 51%        |

CSR Projects in Aspirational Districts:

| S. No. | State        | Aspirational District   | Amount spent (In INR) |
|--------|--------------|-----------------------|-----------------------|
| 1      | Haryana      | Nuh and Mewat         | 1,20,000              |
| 2      | Bihar        | Aurangabad, Begusarai, Gaya, Jamui, Khagaria, Mujaffarpur, Navada, Sitamarhi | 5,40,000              |
| 3      | Rajasthan    | Baran, Dholpur, Karauli | 85,000                |
| 4      | Uttar Pradesh| Chandauli, Fatehpur     | 40,000                |
| 5      | West Bengal  | Nadia                   | 25,000                |
| 6      | Tamil Nadu   | Ramanathapuram          | 7,50,000              |

Preferential Procurement Policy:
*   No preferential procurement policy for marginalized/ vulnerable groups.

Intellectual Properties:
*   Not applicable. DLF does not have any intellectual properties owned or acquired by the entity based on traditional knowledge.

Environmental Impact Assessment:
*   100% of the critical value chain partners including contractors and vendors engaged in construction of the projects and FM Partners engaged in management of the rental properties are evaluated on environmental parameters.

Trade and Industry Chambers/ Associations:
*   DLF has affiliations with 15 trade and industry chambers/ associations.

Top Trade and Industry Chambers/ Associations:

| S. No. | Name of the trade and industry chambers/ associations                                  | Reach of trade and industry chambers/ associations |
|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------|
| 1      | Confederation of Indian Industry (CII)                                                 | National                                           |
| 2      | Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI)                           | National                                           |
| 3      | The Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (ASSOCHAM)                     | National                                           |

| 8      | CII Delhi                                                                              | State                                              |

| 10     | CREDAI Western UP                                                                      | State                                              |
| 11     | CREDAI Haryana                                                                         | State                                              |
| 12     | CREDAI Goa                                                                             | State                                              |
| 13     | CREDAI Chennai                                                                         | State                                              |
| 14     | NAREDCO Haryana                                                                        | State                                              |
| 15     | Telangana Real Estate Developers’ Association (TREDA)                                  | State                                              |

Anti-Competitive Conduct:
*   There were no incidents of anti-competitive conduct by DLF during FY 2022-23.

Consumer Communication and Information:
*   Any risk of disruption/ discontinuation of essential services is timely communicated to customers occupying the leased properties, through e-mail communication by the FM Teams.
*   Product related information is included in the relevant documents provided to the customers at the time of building handover or while entering into a lease agreement, which is as per the local legislation.
*   Customers are provided with a user handbook which includes information on building features and guidelines for ensuring safe and responsible usage of buildings.
*   Information related to LEED certifications are displayed in all leased buildings.

Consumer Satisfaction:

Data Breaches:
*   Number of instances of data breaches along-with impact: Nil.
*   Percentage of data breaches involving personally identifiable information of customers: Nil."}

*   LEED Pre-Certification for ‘Platinum’ rating (Core and Shell Development) from USGBC.

*   ISO 9001 certified Quality Management System.
*   WELL Health-Safety Rating for Facility Operations and Management by International WELL Building Institute.
*   Sword of Honour from the British Safety Council-five-star safety rating system, awarded to DLF’s commercial, retail and hospitality properties.
*   DLF’s New project Arbour received LEED Platinum Rating by IGBC (Pre-Certification).
*   DLF Downtown, Gurugram and DLF Downtown, Chennai received LEED Platinum Rating by USGBC (Pre-Certifciation).
*   40.4 Mn. Sq.ft. or 99.05% of rental portfolio is LEED Platinum Certified as on 31 March 2023.
DLF's Corporate Social Responsibility Policy:
*   In accordance with the provisions of Section 135 of the Companies Act, 2013 and the Rules made thereunder.
Energy and Water Consumption:
*   By 2030, to reduce energy intensity in DLF’s rental assets (energy consumption per square feet of rental portfolio) by 15% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0129 MWh/ sq.ft energy intensity in rental assets (energy consumption in MWh per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23.
*   By 2025, increase renewable energy intensity in DLF’s rental assets by 20% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0020 MWh/ sq.ft. renewable energy intensity in rental assets (energy consumption from renewable sources in MWh per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23, which increased by 8.12% from the baseline.
*   By 2025, reduce water intensity in DLF’s rental assets (freshwater consumption per square feet of rental portfolio) by 10% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0583 KL/ sq.ft. water intensity in the rental assets (freshwater consumption in KL per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23, which decreased by 30.73% from the baseline.
Social Stewardship:
*   To ensure zero harm each year, i.e. zero fatalities resulting from operations, each year, including operation and maintenance of portfolio and development of assets (construction).
*   Zero harm status maintained in FY 2022-23, i.e. there were no fatalities or lost time injuries resulting from operations, including both operation and maintenance of portfolio and development of assets (construction).
Sustainable Business:
*   Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements.
*   Compliance with all regulatory requirements maintained in FY 2022-23.
*   By 2030, ensure that at least 90% of total rental portfolio is Green Building certified.

Training and Awareness Programmes on Principles:
*   Board of Directors (BoDs):
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 15
    *   Topics/ principles covered: Regulatory Updates, Risk Management and Business Development.
    *   Percentage of persons covered by the awareness programmes: 100%
*   Key Managerial Personnel (KMPs):
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 3
    *   Topics/ principles covered: DLF Code of Conduct, Prevention of Sexual Harassment at Workplace, SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015.
    *   Percentage of persons covered by the awareness programmes: 100%
*   Employees other than BoDs & KMPs:
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 11
    *   Topics/ principles covered: DLF Code of Conduct, Prevention of Sexual Harassment at Workplace, Health, Safety, Security and Environment, Environment Management, Awareness on Standard Operating Procedures for safety, Work at Height, Electrical Safety, Emergency Response Management, Safety Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment, Responsible.

Customer Communication and Complaint Management:
*   A dedicated team of qualified Customer Relationship Management (CRM) personnel have been appointed to address each complaint.
*   Mechanism communicated via contact no./ e-mail through the first letter of correspondence.
*   Implemented a robust complaint management system through a digital application.
*   Customers can register a complaint through the app and monitor the status.
*   Customers can also write to the Company through its Customer Support Portal on DLF website: https://www.dlf.in/customer-Support.

Turnover of Products and Services:
*   As a percentage to total turnover:
    *   Environmental and social parameters relevant to the product: 100%
    *   Safe and responsible usage: 100%
    *   Recycling and/ or safe disposal: 100%

Consumer Complaints (FY 2022-23):
*   Data privacy: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Advertising: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Cyber-security: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Delivery of essential services: 904 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0) These included complaints related to provision to essential services in DLF’s rental buildings (provision of electricity, security, etc.) that were promptly resolved.
*   Restrictive Trade Practices: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Unfair Trade Practices: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Other: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)

Product Recalls:
*   Not Applicable due to nature of business of DLF.

Cyber Security and Data Privacy:
*   DLF has an Information Security Policy supported by management procedures.
*   The IT Security Policy is available on the Company’s intranet and circulated to all employees.
*   Established procedures to ensure data privacy of its customers, employees and other stakeholders.
*   Collected data is protected through regular security upgrades and adequate employee training.
*   DLF seeks customer’s consent before.

Data Breaches:
*   Number of instances of data breaches: Nil.
*   Percentage of data breaches involving personally identifiable information of customers: Nil.

Health and Safety Management System:
*   DLF has implemented an occupational health and safety management system aligned to ISO 45001, covering entire operations.
*   Covers the entire business including project sites, managed assets (operational premises) and the hospitality division.

Processes to Identify Work-Related Hazards and Assess Risks:
*   Incident Investigation and Risk Analysis: DLF has a group wide procedure for identification of work-related hazards.
*   A 5x5 Risk Matrix is deployed across DLF.
*   Weekly walkthroughs and scheduled safety observations are performed.
*   Health and Safety Audits: Health and safety audits are conducted for DLF’s rental properties by independent agencies as per ISO 45001 standard.
*   Risk assessments are reviewed on a yearly basis.

Processes for Workers to Report Work-Related Hazards:
*   DLF has a well-defined Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for incident reporting, classification and investigation.
*   Initiatives undertaken to promote reporting of work-related hazards and hazardous situations:
    *   Safety Inspector of the Day (SIOD): Every day, one employee of a particular site is nominated as the SIOD."}

*   Sword of Honour from the British Safety Council-five-star safety rating system, awarded to DLF’s commercial, retail and hospitality properties.
*   DLF’s New project Arbour received LEED Platinum Rating by IGBC (Pre-Certification).
*   DLF Downtown, Gurugram and DLF Downtown, Chennai received LEED Platinum Rating by USGBC (Pre-Certifciation).
*   40.4 Mn. Sq.ft. or 99.05% of rental portfolio is LEED Platinum Certified as on 31 March 2023.
DLF's Corporate Social Responsibility Policy:
*   In accordance with the provisions of Section 135 of the Companies Act, 2013 and the Rules made thereunder.
Energy and Water Consumption:
*   By 2030, to reduce energy intensity in DLF’s rental assets (energy consumption per square feet of rental portfolio) by 15% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0129 MWh/ sq.ft energy intensity in rental assets (energy consumption in MWh per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23.
*   By 2025, increase renewable energy intensity in DLF’s rental assets by 20% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0020 MWh/ sq.ft. renewable energy intensity in rental assets (energy consumption from renewable sources in MWh per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23, which increased by 8.12% from the baseline.
*   By 2025, reduce water intensity in DLF’s rental assets (freshwater consumption per square feet of rental portfolio) by 10% using FY 2019-20 as baseline.
*   0.0583 KL/ sq.ft. water intensity in the rental assets (freshwater consumption in KL per square feet of rental portfolio) in FY 2022-23, which decreased by 30.73% from the baseline.
Social Stewardship:
*   To ensure zero harm each year, i.e. zero fatalities resulting from operations, each year, including operation and maintenance of portfolio and development of assets (construction).
*   Zero harm status maintained in FY 2022-23, i.e. there were no fatalities or lost time injuries resulting from operations, including both operation and maintenance of portfolio and development of assets (construction).
Sustainable Business:
*   Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements.
*   Compliance with all regulatory requirements maintained in FY 2022-23.
*   By 2030, ensure that at least 90% of total rental portfolio is Green Building certified.

Training and Awareness Programmes on Principles:
*   Board of Directors (BoDs):
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 15
    *   Topics/ principles covered: Regulatory Updates, Risk Management and Business Development.
    *   Percentage of persons covered by the awareness programmes: 100%
*   Key Managerial Personnel (KMPs):
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 3
    *   Topics/ principles covered: DLF Code of Conduct, Prevention of Sexual Harassment at Workplace, SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015.
    *   Percentage of persons covered by the awareness programmes: 100%
*   Employees other than BoDs & KMPs:
    *   Total number of training and awareness programmes held: 11
    *   Topics/ principles covered: DLF Code of Conduct, Prevention of Sexual Harassment at Workplace, Health, Safety, Security and Environment, Environment Management, Awareness on Standard Operating Procedures for safety, Work at Height, Electrical Safety, Emergency Response Management, Safety Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment, Responsible.

Customer Communication and Complaint Management:
*   A dedicated team of qualified Customer Relationship Management (CRM) personnel have been appointed to address each complaint.
*   Mechanism communicated via contact no./ e-mail through the first letter of correspondence.
*   Implemented a robust complaint management system through a digital application.
*   Customers can register a complaint through the app and monitor the status.
*   Customers can also write to the Company through its Customer Support Portal on DLF website: https://www.dlf.in/customer-Support.

Turnover of Products and Services:
*   As a percentage to total turnover:
    *   Environmental and social parameters relevant to the product: 100%
    *   Safe and responsible usage: 100%
    *   Recycling and/ or safe disposal: 100%

Consumer Complaints (FY 2022-23):
*   Data privacy: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Advertising: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Cyber-security: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Delivery of essential services: 904 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0) These included complaints related to provision to essential services in DLF’s rental buildings (provision of electricity, security, etc.) that were promptly resolved.
*   Restrictive Trade Practices: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Unfair Trade Practices: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)
*   Other: 0 (Pending resolution at end of year: 0)

Product Recalls:
*   Not Applicable due to nature of business of DLF.

Cyber Security and Data Privacy:
*   DLF has an Information Security Policy supported by management procedures.
*   The IT Security Policy is available on the Company’s intranet and circulated to all employees.
*   Established procedures to ensure data privacy of its customers, employees and other stakeholders.
*   Collected data is protected through regular security upgrades and adequate employee training.
*   DLF seeks customer’s consent before.

Data Breaches:
*   Number of instances of data breaches: Nil.
*   Percentage of data breaches involving personally identifiable information of customers: Nil.

Health and Safety Management System:
*   DLF has implemented an occupational health and safety management system aligned to ISO 45001, covering entire operations.
*   Covers the entire business including project sites, managed assets (operational premises) and the hospitality division.

Processes to Identify Work-Related Hazards and Assess Risks:
*   Incident Investigation and Risk Analysis: DLF has a group wide procedure for identification of work-related hazards.
*   A 5x5 Risk Matrix is deployed across DLF.
*   Weekly walkthroughs and scheduled safety observations are performed.
*   Health and Safety Audits: Health and safety audits are conducted for DLF’s rental properties by independent agencies as per ISO 45001 standard.
*   Risk assessments are reviewed on a yearly basis.

Processes for Workers to Report Work-Related Hazards:
*   DLF has a well-defined Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for incident reporting, classification and investigation.
*   Initiatives undertaken to promote reporting of work-related hazards and hazardous situations:
    *   Safety Inspector of the Day (SIOD): Every day, one employee of a particular site is nominated as the SIOD.
